sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
    3
   / \
  1---2---4
      |
      5
```

Identify the cut vertices and bridges in this graph.
message_2:
In the given graph, a cut vertex is a vertex whose removal increases the number of connected components. A bridge is an edge whose removal increases the number of connected components.

Cut vertices: Vertex 2 is a cut vertex. If we remove vertex 2, the graph will be split into three connected components: {1, 3}, {4}, and {5}.

Bridges: The edge connecting vertices 2 and 4 (2---4) is a bridge. If we remove this edge, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 2, 3, 5} and {4}.
